main event: A round shiny object was observed moving from northwest to southeast over Mt. Holly and Riverside, New Jersey on July 25, 1958.
interesting points: The object was visible for 25 minutes,There was a weather balloon observed heading southeast at the same time,The object was flying at an altitude of 2,000 feet,The sighting was classified as a ground-visual observation,The report concludes it was probably a balloon.
witness description: No specific witnesses confirmed provided in the report.
